page.title: 14VALE OF CLWYD_RURAL LEISURE.
page.content: {Hunting}:This is not encouraged on the large estate.The terrain is unsuitable as there are so many wide ditches and barbed wire is used extensively.The {local hunt}ride on the Eastern hill area.{Otter hunting}has taken place in living memory.The group was not local (possibly from Lancashire)Men and women in blue livery and carrying staffs took part,hunting on foot.{Shooting:One estate has a gamekeeper and organises shoots of pheasants and wild duck.Eight guns are allowed,and those taking part currently pay Â£11.50 per bird for pheasants.There are also duck shoots,mallard,teal and a few shoveler ducks.This year 600 mallard were reared.
